alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Gilmer; Kanawha; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:13PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, northern Nicholas, northeastern Kanawha, southern Gilmer, Braxton, southeastern Roane and Clay Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1212 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Arnoldsburg to near Clendenin. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sutton, Grantsville, Clay, Clendenin, Gassaway, Arnoldsburg, Big Otter, Cedar Creek State Park, Wallback, Amma, Harrison, Burnsville, Flatwoods, Nebo, Shock, Millstone, Procious, Rosedale, Mount Zion and Little Birch. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 19 and 80. Route 19 between mile markers 64 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
